Item: Real coach data from FC (35 coaches with bios/photos/booking URLs)
Notes: Ask: 'Who on your side owns the coach information — bios, photos, booking links? Is it centralized or spread across different people?' and 'What does your ideal timeline look like for getting us that data?' CSV template ready to hand over at workshop.

Item: Understand FC's email and network environment
Blocks: OTP auth, magic links, all email sending
Notes: Ask: 'When your participants get emails from FC today — coaching assignments, reminders — where do those come from? Is there an internal system or a third-party tool?' and 'Have you run into issues with internal mail systems blocking emails from external tools?' Surfaces deliverability risk and provider options organically.

Item: Understand FC's IT environment and hosting preferences
Notes: Ask: 'Help us understand your IT environment. When you think about where this platform lives long-term, what does that look like?' and 'What's your team's experience been with deploying new tools? How does that process typically work with your IT group?' We've already started building on cloud infra — need to understand their migration timeline and data residency needs.

Blocks: Coach selector UI, Slice 1 API design
Notes: Ask: 'Walk us through what happens today when a new participant gets matched with a coach' and 'When a participant is looking for a coach, what matters most to them?' and 'What would a bad match look like — what are you trying to avoid?' Let the filtering approach emerge from their answers rather than presenting options.
Tim gave slide access. Verify all 5 flagged items are fixed + check for other issues.

Item: Prepare CSV template for FC coach data
Notes: Define required columns: name/email/bio/photo/specialties/languages/location/credentials/videoUrl/meetingBookingUrl/maxEngagements. Hand to Andrea at workshop.

Item: Identify single point of contact for fast decisions
Notes: Ask: 'Between now and March 2, there are going to be moments where we need a quick answer to keep moving. How does your team prefer to handle those? Who's the best person to go to?' Let them self-identify rather than imposing structure.

Item: March 9 continuity plan (Amit at Mayo Clinic)
Notes: Between March 2 (Coach Selector live) and March 16 (full portal). Critical timing gap.
Ask: 'Is there a preference for where participant data lives? Any data residency requirements?' Surfaces DNS/domain question naturally. e.g. coaching.franklincovey.com.
CIL Brief: 'NDA/IT procurement required.' Questions sent to Blaine.

Ask Kari: 'You built a prototype on Lovable — what was the one thing it got right that you'd want us to keep? And what was the biggest gap?' Then: 'What are the key topics and outcomes your coaches track in sessions today?' Current config.ts has placeholder list.
Government contract — likely required. Ask: 'Are there specific accessibility standards we need to meet for this engagement?' Building accessibly by default.

Item: Understand FC's approach to participant re-engagement
Notes: Ask Andrea: 'When an engagement stalls today, how do you find out about it? What does your current process look like?' and 'When a participant goes quiet, what's worked in the past to re-engage them?' and 'How much communication volume is too much — are participants already getting a lot of emails?' Let the nudge approach emerge from understanding her workflow.

Ask Greg: 'Beyond this first engagement, what does success look like for the coaching platform a year from now?' and 'What's the biggest risk you see between now and March 2?' Ask the room: 'If we could only ship one thing perfectly by March 2, what would it be?' These build relationship AND reveal true priorities.

Ask: 'For the 5-session participants, tell us about the intro call. What's the goal of that conversation and how does it work today?' Likely just a booking link — let them confirm rather than us recommending.
